what_learn: What you will learn? Throughout the course, students will develop a deep and comprehensive understanding of their chosen performing arts discipline, whether it's acting, dance, music, or theatre. Student will learn to harness their creative abilities to transform their ideas into compelling performances, media productions or visual artworks. Students will acquire the skills to critically analyse and assess different artworks to gain a deep understanding of the creative process. Students will gain experience working in teams, learning how to collaborate effectively with professionals from diverse artistic backgrounds, fostering a spirit of innovation and adaptability. Students will gain valuable insights into the performing arts and creative media industry, including its history, current trends, and business practices. Students will explore how the performing arts and creative media can transcend borders and cultures, promoting cross-cultural understanding and addressing global issues.

career: Career prospects Graduate can pursue career as a Performer in theatre, film, Music Concert, Dance Programme and live Performance Art. A graduate has the opportunity to work as educators in schools, colleges, community centers and private institutions teaching Performing Arts and Media Productions. With a background in creative media, graduates can work behind the scenes as directors, producers, cinematographers, editors, or in various technical roles within the film and television industry. Performing arts and creative media skills can be valuable in advertising, where graduates can work as creative directors, copywriters, or in production and promotion of commercials and marketing materials.
